item.title: OpenAI seems pretty nervous that its new new voice cloning tool will be a voice scamming tool
item.description:
OpenAI announced a new AI-based audio cloning tool called Voice Engine on Friday. While the company is obviously proud of the potential of this technology—touting how it could be used to provide reading assistance for kids and give a voice to those who’ve lost theirs—OpenAI is clearly very nervous about how this could…

item.dc:creator: Matt Novak / Gizmodo

item.title: Apple says the DOJ's antitrust lawsuit is misleading
item.description:
Apple will not apologize for its little blue bubbles. The company told Quartz this week that the Department of Justice’s big antitrust lawsuit — which guns for basically everything about Apple’s ubiquitous iPhone — is misleading.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Laura Bratton

item.title: What stores are open and closed on Easter Sunday?
item.description:
Easter is approaching this Sunday and consumers may need to pivot to make good on their Easter Bunny promises. Easter falls on Sunday, March 31 this year. The occasion is often marked by egg painting and chocolate bunnies.

item.title: BlackRock's Larry Fink is bullish on Bitcoin as spot Bitcoin ETFs fly past $12 billion
item.description:
The approval of 11 spot Bitcoin ETFs earlier this year by the Securities and Exchange Commission has caused a storm in the ETF industry. And now, according to Farside, the total net inflows to spot Bitcoin ETFs have surpassed $12 billion. On an average basis, there have been $258 million worth of inflows to…

item.title: Microsoft and OpenAI plan supercomputer project worth $100 billion called 'Stargate,' report says
item.description:
The OpenAI and Microsoft partnership is heating up, with executives at both companies reportedly drawing up plans for a U.S.-based data center that could cost up to $100 billion.

item.title: A timeline of United Airlines' really bumpy month
item.description:
United Airlines is having a hard month. Their planes keep having safety incidents. There have been 14 in the U.S. so far, according to the Federal Aviation Administration. Nobody’s been injured, so that’s good. But it can’t feel great to have to reassure your customers that flying on your planes is perfectly safe.…

item.title: Kia recalled almost 430,000 Telluride SUVs that might roll away while parked
item.description:
Kia is recalling 427,407 Telluride SUVs because they can roll away — even when put into park.

item.title: Fed Chair Jerome Powell is in no hurry to lower interest rates
item.description:
The Federal Reserve is patiently waiting for more positive inflation readings before making the decision to lower interest rates, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said Friday.

item.title: Another United Airlines plane had to land early with mechanical issues — and yes, it was a Boeing jet
item.description:
Another United Airlines plane, another long-haul trip cut short. For the 14th time this month, one of the carrier’s planes had a safety issue that the Federal Aviation Administration has had to investigate. The flight, initially leaving San Francisco for Paris, was able to land safely in Denver after the crew…

item.title: New York City's AI chatbot is telling people to break laws and do crimes

Salad kit maker Fresh Express is abandoning a $308 million deal to acquire food company Dole’s vegetable business, the Justice Department said.

item.title: Trump Media got the meme stock treatment and it's riding high — for now
item.description:
Former President Donald Trump’s media company hit the public markets hot on Tuesday, closing out its debut day trading with an $8 billion valuation. It ended a shortened trading week another $390 million higher.

item.title: Amazon is now selling Clinique products on its premium beauty store
item.description:
Estée Lauder launched its cosmetic brand Clinique on the Amazon Premium Beauty store earlier this week. It makes Clinique the first brand of the cosmetic giant to sell its beauty products on the e-commerce site.

item.title: Ford CEO Jim Farley's pay ballooned to $26.5 million last year

item.title: The weight loss drug shortage is hitting Eli Lily’s Zepbound
item.description:
Sales of a new class of weight loss drugs known as GLP-1s have transformed Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk into the most valuable pharmaceutical companies in the world. item.description:
When OpenAI released ChatGPT in 2022, it may not have realized it was setting a company spokesperson loose on the internet. item.description:

item.title: Scientists somehow made the internet go 4.5 million times faster
item.description:
There’s nothing more frustrating than a bad internet connection, but researchers out of Aston University may have just solved that problem forever. A new method allowed scientists in the UK to send data 4.5 million times faster than average broadband, setting a new world record.

item.title: Easter is almost here and chocolate prices are rising faster than Bitcoin
item.description:
Talk about sweet returns. As Easter approaches, the cost of chocolate candy ingredient cocoa has spent the year skyrocketing. Spot prices are up more than 127% since the end of 2023. item.title: Ozempic costs just $5 to make, a study said. The backlash was swift
item.description:
Novo Nordisk is facing two-pronged pressure from lawmakers and patient advocates to make its popular diabetes medication Ozempic more affordable. The calls come on the heels of a recent study that found it costs less than $5 to produce a month’s supply of Ozempic.
